sentences.sentence: It is unfortunate that your editorial ("There is plenty the West can do for Ukraine", January 8) didn't consider the basic point well made in James Curran's opinion piece ("History's judgment still awaits John Howard on Iraq") on the facing page.Sadly, the Ukraine conflict follows a similar path to that of the Iraq war, with disinformation and a reluctance to properly confront all of the underlying factors, and likely outcomes.
Western echo-chamber discussions, in particular the refusal to heed any perspectives challenging the superficial good/bad narrative, have led to this unnecessary tragedy.

Even less so has there been any genuine consideration of how the conflict could be resolved.While Russia's war is illegal under international law (as indeed was the war in Iraq), the mantra that there were no provocations or opportunities to prevent it is pure denialism.
Both sides have legitimate claims.It is also now undeniable that the parties reached settlement terms in April 2022 but US and British intervention prevented finalisation.

It is a US-Russia proxy war.Massive military aid has not advanced the Ukrainian negotiating position - it has ultimately only weakened it, amid the destruction of thousands of lives as well as the country's infrastructure.

That this could be acceptable to us - because our people are not directly affected and, even worse, because the military aid is spent here - is immoral.A just peace can only come through diplomacy, and it should start now.Mark KwiatkowskiCurtin, ACT

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: It is unfortunate that your editorial ("There is plenty the West can do for Ukraine", January 8) didn't consider the basic point well made in James Curran's opinion piece ("History's judgment still awaits John Howard on Iraq") on the facing page.Sadly, the Ukraine conflict follows a similar path to that of the Iraq war, with disinformation and a reluctance to properly confront all of the underlying factors, and likely outcomes. Western echo-chamber discussions, in particular the refusal to heed any perspectives challenging the superficial good/bad narrative, have led to this unnecessary tragedy. Even less so has there been any genuine consideration of how the conflict could be resolved.While Russia's war is illegal under international law (as indeed was the war in Iraq), the mantra that there were no provocations or opportunities to prevent it is pure denialism. Both sides have legitimate claims.It is also now undeniable that the parties reached settlement terms in April 2022 but US and British intervention prevented finalisation. It is a US-Russia proxy war.Massive military aid has not advanced the Ukrainian negotiating position - it has ultimately only weakened it, amid the destruction of thousands of lives as well as the country's infrastructure. That this could be acceptable to us - because our people are not directly affected and, even worse, because the military aid is spent here - is immoral.A just peace can only come through diplomacy, and it should start now.Mark KwiatkowskiCurtin, ACT
